refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Many Telepathy Channel objects can be seen as representing groups or sets of contacts. The Telepathy specification represents this by a common interface, Group. This section documents the auto-generated GInterface used to implement the Group interface.
Contacts can be in four states:
* "local pending" (waiting to be added to the group by the local client calling AddMembers())
* "remote pending" (waiting to be added to the group by some other action, probably by someone else)
* no relationship with the group at all

For instance, chatrooms implement the Group interface. Contacts in the chatroom are members, and contacts who we've invited to the group, or contacts who've requested permission to join, are remote pending. If the local user has been invited by another contact, they will appear in the local-pending set until they accept or decline the invitation.

refsect2.title: TpSvcChannelInterfaceGroup
refsect2.para: Dummy typedef representing any implementation of this interface.

refsect2.title: TpSvcChannelInterfaceGroupClass
refsect2.para: The class of TpSvcChannelInterfaceGroup.

refsect2.title: tp_svc_channel_interface_group_add_members_impl ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*tp_svc_channel_interface_group_add_members_impl) (TpSvcChannelInterfaceGroup *self, const GArray *in_Contacts, const gchar *in_Message, DBusGMethodInvocation *context);
refsect2.para: The signature of an implementation of the D-Bus method AddMembers on interface org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Interface.Group.

listitem.simpara: Used to return values or throw an error

refsect2.title: tp_svc_channel_interface_group_implement_add_members ()
refsect2.para: Register an implementation for the AddMembers method in the vtable of an implementation of this interface. To be called from the interface init function.

listitem.simpara: A class whose instances implement this interface
A callback used to implement the AddMembers D-Bus method

refsect2.title: tp_svc_channel_interface_group_return_from_add_members ()
refsect2.para: Return successfully by calling dbus_g_method_return(). This inline function exists only to provide type-safety.
